name: Found the Majilis al Wukala
description: With our rule over Hejaz and the Holy Cities secure it is time to form a proper government in the form of the Majilis al Wukala or Council of Ministers. Once orderly rule has been established the King can begin to exert power through his ministers and start up greater reforms to cement our rule.

name: Incorporate Family Networks
description: Familial ties often create the best allies and by embedding blood ties deep into the web of governance and the bureaucracy, dissent in the civic life against the King can be safely neutered.

name: Arabicise the Ottoman Civil Service
description: Unfortunately our young government has been forced to make use of the original Ottoman civil service in the region and these administrators' loyalties are tenuous at best. Measures must be taken to create a more loyal and purely Arab civil service.

name: Found the General Directorate for Police
description: Unless we are to allow anarchy to stalk Hejaz, a more centralised and special security board must be created so as to better manage and coordinate the enforcement of laws in the Holy Cities and beyond.

name: Ban Secret Societies
description: Secret societies are breeding grounds for dissent against the King and serve only to subvert moral and civil governance. A ban is necessary to force them into the open and promulgate a more thorough crackdown.

name: Establish a State Directed Curriculum
description: Currently education in Hejaz is either non-existent or inconsistent. It is a necessity for the state to create a consistent and centralised curriculum to expand education and fight illiteracy in the Kingdom.

name: Found the Ministry of Religious Affairs
description: Hejaz is the home to the Holy Cities and it is essential to be a moral Kingdom. The Ministry of Religious Affairs shall regulate the maintenance of mosques, the Hajj pilgrimage and promote good practice of Islam.

name: Appoint the Shayk al-Islām
description: The Shayk al-Islām is Islam’s foremost legal authority and theoretically presides over the whole judicial and theological hierarchy of Islam. By our virtue of controlling the Holy Cities, the responsibility of appointment falls to us.

name: Claim the Mantle of the Caliphate
description: Now with the House of Osman shattered, as the stewards of the Holy Cities and the appointers of the Shayk al-Islām, it is time to claim the mantle of the Caliphate of all Muslims and lead the Ummah.

name: Establish the Mudiriya
description: As the Kingdom grows, it is time to establish the Mudiriya or General Directorate of Finance. Foreign experts shall be invited to assist in overseeing the organisation of financial measures and the Kingdom's fiscal policy.

name: Instate the Hajj Tax
description: As has the Stewards of the Holy Cities, we are the Guardians of the Hajj pilgrimage and so are able to charge the Hajj tax. Surely all faithful will have no qualms with lining the coffers of the custodians of the Cities.

name: Found the Meccan Urban Planning Commission
description: The city of Mecca is the most notable and holiest city in Islam and so planning and development must be done with the utmost care. By establishing an urban planning commission, the city shall be preserved and development can be promoted without impeding on the holy sites.

name: Pacify the Hejazi Bedouin
description: The Bedouin tribes are still opposed to our rule and are a thorn in the side of the kingdom. Pacification of these unruly elements is a necessity if we are to ensure the continued stability of the Hejaz.

name: The Directorate of Motor Transport
description: Motor vehicles are a new Western innovation and are becoming more prevalent in Hejaz, especially among Hajj pilgrims. Simply put, travel via motor car or bus is more comfortable than camel and would allow a greater proportion of pilgrims to undertake the Hajj journey.

name: Re-open Foreign Consulates
description: Now that Hejaz is beginning to re-exert itself on the world stage we must begin to reestablish a diplomatic presence abroad and improve our relations with foreign countries, especially if we are to solidify ourselves as the rightful custodians of the Holy Cities.

name: Found the Directorate of Gifts and Donations
description: As Hajj pilgrims begin to pour into Mecca, a special Directorate must be established to regulate the proceeds of gifts and donations to the state so that they be reinvested in local infrastructure as well as the redistribution of offerings among the Bedouin tribes.

name: State Visits to the Faithful
description: Hejaz must solidify itself as the rightful rulers of the Holy Cities and the preeminent leaders of the faith. To do this, the King shall make state visits and improve the relations with those who are faithful and loyal to Hajj stewardship of the Cities.

name: Cooperate with Foreign Airlines
description: As we enter a brave new world of transport innovations, airplanes; once a novelty and weapon of war, have become progressively more used for civilian transport. By working with foreign airlines, the Hajj can become even more accessible for Muslims the world over.

name: Pursue Arab Unification
description: Now that we have attained extensive foreign recognition, Hejaz may pursue its dreams of unifying the Arabs under the rightful rule of the Caliph of Islam and stewards of the Holy Cities.

name: Incorporate the Arab Gulf
description: The Arab Gulf has now fallen under our control though we will need to be properly integrated into our administration if we are to govern it properly and our new subjects to accept our rule.

name: Incorporate Central Arabia
description: Central Arabia has now fallen under our control though we will need to be properly integrated into our administration if we are to govern it properly and our new subjects to accept our rule.

name: Incorporate Asir
description: Asir has now fallen under our control though we will need to be properly integrated into our administration if we are to govern it properly and our new subjects to accept our rule.

name: Nationalise the Hejaz Railway Corporation
description: The Hejaz Railway Corporation continues to operate in the territories of the Kingdom, yet it would function more efficiently if it were brought directly under the control of the government.

name: Found the Arabian Transport Company
description: Logistics in Hejaz is woefully lacking and uncoordinated. By establishing the ATC, economic development in the Kingdom will be accelerated and all logistics shall grow more centralised and coherent.

name: The General Syndicate for Automobiles
description: The King has taken it upon himself to ensure the convenience of pilgrims and provide them with all that could help them overcome difficulties on their way to performing Hajj and Umrah. The new general syndicate will allow Hejaz subjects to rent their cars to pilgrims and dovetail motor transportation throughout the kingdom.

name: Encourage Domestic Manufacturing
description: Hejaz lacks much industry though with targeted subsidies, investment and encouragement from the government we can begin to grow our industry and improve the local economy.

name: The Directorate for Mining and Shipping
description: Hejaz is home to small and thriving mining ventures but getting the products of these ventures has proven costly and nearly impossible. By establishing a centralised Directorate on the matter of mining and shipping the goods to international markets our output will be able to benefit us greatly.

name: Re-open Mahd ahd Dhahab
description: Mahd ahd Dhahab is one of the more notable mining ventures in Arabia and sees a steady output of gold. By reopening the mine we can further line the state coffers and boost the growth of our wealth.

name: Expand Jeddah Shipping
description: Jeddah is the most notable coastal city in Hejaz and the home of a minor but flourishing shipping industry. By expanding this business venture, the Hejazi exports will be able to expand into new markets.

name: The Directorate for Military Affairs
description: Unfortunately Hejaz is not particularly capable in military matters and will require further investment. The Directorate for Military Affairs shall seek to rectify this problem and develop the Hejazi army.

name: Inaugurate the Jeddah Coast Guard
description: The coast of Hejaz is lawless and undefended; the Military Directorate has seen it time to establish and inaugurate a proper coast guard so as to defend our shores from dangers and coastal interlopers.

name: The Sharifian School of Naval Sciences
description: Naval technology has advanced greatly in recent decades though unfortunately Hejaz has fallen behind on these developments. The King himself has seen it fit to personally sponsor a special college in Jeddah to educate naval cadets into these new developments.

name: Dockyards of Jeddah
description: The dockyards of Jeddah are bustling with trade and ships from across the world. Money pours in every day and it is only natural we reinvest these profits to create newer and better dockyards for our thriving industry.

name: The Commission for Weapons Acquisition
description: Hejaz lacks a native arms industry and arming our soldiers is proving difficult as surplus supplies run low. The Military Directorate proposes the creation of a special commission to purchase and procure foreign weapon contracts.

name: MAS Rifle Contract
description: MAS is a French weapons company that still survives despite syndicalism in the French mainland and they are more than eager to supply us with weapons. We should capitalise on this deal and create a mutually beneficial relationship.

name: Cooperate with OPEL
description: OPEL is a German automobile maker and has shown an interest in supplying the Kingdom's military with trucks and armoured cars to help buy our military forces. While it may be somewhat expensive, these modern military marvels will be worth every penny.

name: Create the Jeddah Munitions Factory
description: Jeddah is quickly becoming home to a thriving local industry and it is only natural to create an extensive weapons development complex. Hejaz will be able to design and develop its own weapons and properly supply the domestic military forces.

name: Disband Tribal Militia
description: Now that Hejaz has thrown off the Ottoman yoke, we must transition to being a proper state and create a professional military. This will involve finally disbanding the tribal militias that helped us assert our independence.

name: Create Al Jeish Al Arabi
description: The Al Jeish Al Arabi, or Arab Legion, shall be the centre of a new centralised and professional military force for the Kingdom and has to be drilled to a fault.

name: Decentralised Army Command
description: If the overthrowal of the Turks has taught us anything it is that a decentralised force is optimal in fighting our enemies. Rigid hierarchies will serve the military no benefit over locally coordinated troops.

name: Regulate Conscription
description: Conscription is a modern necessity for Hejaz and service must be made compulsory if we are to create a professional and standard army. Obviously this will need to be regulated and properly enforced.

name: Arabian Horsemanship
description: The armies of Arabia are renowned for their horsemanship and the use of cavalry is a blessing in the harsh deserts. Tapping into this practice and skill will be a boon for our army.

name: Incorporate Ottoman Officers
description: Many officers of the Ottoman army remain in Hejaz territory, prepared to be integrated into our armed forces. Their technical expertise will be a great addition to our budding forces.

name: Found the Hejazi Camel Corps
description: Camels are the lifeblood of Arabian society and the Ottomans made great use of them in the past. We should copy this and create our own Hejazi Camel Corps to better facilitate desert operations.

name: Expand the Royal Guard
description: The Royal Guard of Hejaz is one of the most prestigious divisions amidst our military forces. As new threats and dissent arise in the kingdom, we should seek to expand the guard and the forces as a whole.

name: Standardised Firearms
description: The Hejazi military forces lack any form of standardisation, using everywhere from British, French, Ottoman and even domestically made mystery weapons in combat. Due to the abundance of designs it makes supplying said forces a nightmare. Standardisation of firearms will be a great improvement.

name: Found the Hejazi Flying Corps
description: As the Hejazi military forces grow and improve, it is time to take our military might to the skies and vanquish our enemies from above!

name: The Hawker Fury Deal
description: Hawker are a British company, now in exile, though they are still keen to sell us a few planes and this would prove well in beginning our small flying forces.

name: Establish Ta'if Airbase
description: Ta'if is a small city located near Mecca and could be instrumental in air defences. By building our first airbase there, the Holy Cities shall be safe from dangers in the sky.

name: Found the Medina Air Academy
description: Hejaz currently lacks a specialised military school for air fighting and so establishing an academy in Medina will help train a new generation of flying cadets.
